main event: A ground visual observation of an object resembling a weather balloon was reported by two witnesses while driving on highway 97 in Southwest Canada on 13-APR-1962.
interesting points: The object was described as being initially 1/3 of the apparent full moon's diameter., The observation lasted for 15 minutes., The object's motion was characterized as jerky and without a definable pattern., The witnesses used 10x50 binoculars to observe the object., The male witness was 50 years old and noted that the motion did not seem characteristic of known astronomical objects.
sighted object: an object resembling a weather balloon
witness description: Male, age 50, while driving an automobile on highway.
